channel.title: [pi] Help Marks [pi]
channel.description: Ok so iv looked for this for awile and i cant figure out how to code it, would post my codes but had to remove so i could use run bat again, but i want to make if a player put (::username helpful) it will give that player a 1 then 2 then 3 and so on for how many times hes been helpful in a notepad so i know whos been helpful latly without having to be online and lisonign to my staff. Anyidea.

item.title: [pi] Help Marks [pi]
item.dc:creator: @JCor9 JCor9
item.description:
@JCor9 wrote:

Wow im about to just make a all new server, iv spent 2 months on this, full summoning, and constrution with emote and now its f***ed up. fml

Edit: i was going to put online 2day also

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] Help Marks [pi]

item.description:
@tomjrmkay wrote:

You’ll have the change the appenddata method to the one that your server base uses. Also the sendmessage method.

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] Help Marks [pi]
item.dc:creator: @tomjrmkay tomjrmkay
item.description:
@tomjrmkay wrote:

It would he easier to do ::helpful username.
Make a command called helpful and have it take the username and write to file that he was helpful. For example

If(cmd[0].startsWith("helpful")){
String username=playerCommand.substring(8);
appendData("helpful.txt", p.username+" says that "+username+" was helpful.");
sendMessage(p, "Success!");
}

Or something along those lines

Read full topic
